title: Tasting Australia: the perfect festival for food lovers
text: What do you have when you combine passionate epicureans, gastronomic delights and world famous wine set among city laneways and cultivated vineyards? The recipe for one of Australia ’s most anticipated culinary festivals – Tasting Australia . The week-long event goes beyond just eating and drinking to uncover what South Australia’s food scene is all about: crusading local and seasonal produce, promoting its diverse culture, championing premium producers and being treated to unforgettable dining experiences. Food lovers from across the globe will descend on Adelaide and South Australia’s surrounding regions to experience Tasting Australia from 1 to 8 May 2016. The state is the perfect host for the foodie festival thanks to its natural abundance and the enthusiasm of local producers to supply the best food and drink possible. The biennial festival attracts around 50,000 people and is a journey of South Australia’s produce from paddock to plate. The popular festival also celebrates real food heroes and is headed up by Patron Maggie Beer (Barossa food legend) and co creative directors Paul Henry (South Australian wine expert) and Simon Bryant (local chef and television personality). Alongside these recognised stars are celebrities known on a more local level for their top-quality produce. Butchers, cheesemakers, fishermen and bakers all have the chance to showcase their produce alongside internationally known vineyards and breweries. Tasting Australia is the perfect introduction to South Australia’s epicurean delights and showcases what you can expect of this place every day Each festival is based around a carefully chosen theme and provides the chance for visitors to experience the best of South Australia by tasting great food and drink, learning more about what goes into making it and inspiring the next generation of foodies. In 2016 the theme is Landscapes. Events will look at how the landscape has shaped the offering of each region and showcases the wide variety of produce and products available in the State. Daily sessions on a stage in the Town Square (the hub of the festival in the heart of the city) see a variety of international and local chefs cooking favourite recipes and teaching visitors special tricks and tips, as well as panel discussions bringing decision makers together to debate issues such as food in Age Care and the effect of the dinner table in family dynamics. Food festival fever: soak up the sun and savour Aussie flavours at the biennial event Vineyards from across the Barossa Valley, Clare Valley, McLaren Vale and Adelaide Hills present their finest vintages to the public with special tastings and pairings with local delicacies. Famed cheesemakers, celebrated eateries and even olive oil specialists all present their finest produce which can be perfectly paired with the appropriate wines. And if you want some top tips on where to go for amazing experiences, local personalities host A Few of My Favourite Things tours taking in bars, eateries, markets and even where they like to go for the perfect cup of coffee. The showcase dinner event is not what you would expect, no menu, no table plans, no tables actually… just a gathering of all the chefs who participate in the eight-day festival, cooking in pairs what they love to eat out of the amazing South Australian produce on offer.. wine makers and spirit makers pour their nectar for you to enjoy while you decide which dish to start with from the 15 stations dotted around the warehouse venue. Tasting Australia is all about participation, engaging with chefs and producers, learning about the variety of amazing produce available and how to match it with a variety of wines and brews. It is the perfect introduction to South Australia’s epicurean delights, and showcases what you can expect of this place every day of the year.
